content:
You must have separate smtp servers for each account, and set each account to send on the smtp that has the same User Name as the sending account.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1350593

content:
The issue seems to be that you've configured a single outgoing (SMTP) server to be used by the 3 accounts when what you really need is different SMTP server settings for each.

What you appear to be missing is that you may create as many outgoing server settings as you wish, independently of your other mail account settings, by choosing Outgoing Server (SMTP) at the bottom of the list of mail accounts in the account settings, then adding as many server settings there as needed, naming them however you wish to better distinguish them. You can then associate each of those SMTP servers with a different account / identity.
creator: DavidGG

content: Thanks. I do understand that now. But what I don't understand is how to separate them. Where would I see/add the smtp1, smtp2 and so on? Would it be better to delete the 2nd & 3rd accounts and start over? I don't remember seeing an option to add additional servers when I added those accounts.
creator: cgreen82

content: The Outgoing Server (SMTP) settings window has buttons to the right of the list of SMTP servers to add, edit and remove server settings to that list. Is that what you're missing now or do you mean something else?
creator: DavidGG

content:
Somehow I have the feeling you didn't fully understand what I said in my first post and are still looking at the SMTP server settings from your other account settings. Look at the Outgoing Server (SMTP) settings window shown in the following article. That's what you have to use to add more SMTP server settings:

https://support.mozilla.org/kb/cannot-send-messages
creator: DavidGG

content: Having "smtp" as part of the server name or not is irrelevant, they may name their servers however they wish, use what they told you to use for the server name.
creator: DavidGG

content: I really appreciate your help & I promise I'm not a complete idiot but this is all like a foreign language to me. If I need to set them up as different servers, don't I need something to differentiate them from each other?
creator: cgreen82

content:
Yes, but you have other fields for that, namely "Description", where you may type whatever you wish or leave empty if you want, and "Username", which is the whole reason you're doing this, so it can be different for each despite the three accounts using the same outgoing server, and is enough to differentiate them if you don't want to use "Description" for that.

The server name must be the same for all because they're all using the same server, it's the username each account uses to access it that's different for each.
creator: DavidGG

content:
What you're seeing is Gmail requiring a stronger form of authentication than merely sending a username and password:

https://support.google.com/mail/answer/7126229

The real question here is why you haven't seen this until now if you've been using Thunderbird with Gmail before…

content: Have you changed the settings in Gmail to accept Third Party email clients?
creator: frisée

content:
It's more likely that your Mail Provider is identifying his emails as SPAM and marking them accordingly. TB accepts the label and deals with the email accordingly.

You could set up a folder in your offline folders and program a filter in to TB so that everything from his email address gets re-routed into it.

Filters can be accessed at Hamburger (top right)/Tools/Message Filters https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/organize-your-messages-using-filters
creator: frisée

content:
Does the user name/email address in the 'From' section of your email (1) match the User name in your SMTP Settings (2) and the email address in your Server Settings (3)?

1 - Hamburger (top right)/Account Settings - click on the name of the account through which you are sending the email. On the right is the return email address called 'Email Address' unless you have put another email address in 'Reply-to Address'.

2 - Hamburger (top right)/Account Settings/Outgoing Server (SMTP). Highlight the server through which you are sending the email and the User Name is displayed at the bottom. It can be changed using the 'Edit' button.

3 - Hamburger (top right)/Account Settings - click on the 'Server Settings' under the account through which you are sending the email. The email address is in the 'User Name' field.
creator: frisée
